info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 5:28AM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...DANGEROUS ROAD CONDITIONS EXPECTED THIS MORNING DUE TO BLACK ICE AND LOCALIZED LIGHT ICE ACCUMULATION POSSIBLE TONIGHT... Numerous roads across the Tennessee Valley and Southern Appalachians remain snow and ice covered from the recent winter storm. Any melted snow and ice will have re-frozen this morning, especially on untreated secondary and rural roads as well as bridges and overpasses. Additionally, black ice will be a major concern this morning as any wet pavement refreezes. Black ice is difficult to see on roads and can result in slick spots. Use caution, slow down, and remain alert if traveling this morning. Please check local road conditions first before traveling this morning. Areas of rain and freezing rain will approach the region tonight. While widespread freezing rain and ice accumulation is not expected across Bradley and Polk Counties, localized icy spots may develop in sheltered valleys, low spots in hilly terrain, and locations near the McMinn County line. Please continue to monitor the forecast for the latest information.
